I hope we can put partisanship aside and work together for real, common-sense solutions so we’re not simply addressing the same emergency situation again once this funding runs out.
We can have an immigration system that reflects our values and secures our border. We can have an immigration system that provides opportunity and security.

It should be a priority of this Congress to make sure that no child is subjected to inhumane conditions for one day longer. This bipartisan compromise will provide immediate relief to those in need, but it won’t fix the broken immigration system that has led us down this path.

We just voted in the House to provide critical funding for the situation at the border. The conditions we’ve seen at the border are unacceptable and action was needed now before funding ran out and the situation became unthinkable.

ICYMI: Overnight, the Administration announced the deployment of another 1,000 troops to the Middle East. Where's the strategy? Where's the plan? My statement is here: https://kim.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-kim-statement-deployment-troops-middle-east …

Spread the word and share with anyone in need. We need more programs like this and a comprehensive national strategy to tackle this epidemic. https://twitter.com/AsburyParkPress/status/1140767330139541504 …

I've talked with servicemembers at our Joint Base who stand at the ready to defend our freedoms. I'm committed to ensuring that if we ask them to put themselves into harm's way to that end, that we fully and articulately explain why and have a clear plan and path to success.
Congress must be briefed on these developments and we should stand ready to exercise our Article I authority before being led into another conflict without end or reason.
Without a clear strategy there is too much room for mistakes and misunderstandings to back us into a war even if that wasn’t the goal. With so much at stake, we have to do it smart.
As with any national security issue, I’ll work with the Administration if they approach with seriousness and strategy.
I share the goal of countering Iran’s nefarious and dangerous actions, and this should be a goal both Democrats and Republicans consider without an ounce of partisanship.
I’ve previously worked on Iraq and Iran issues at the White House during a crisis and I know how complicated these decisions are.
If they don’t, then we’ve seen what happens when we enter a conflict without fully understanding or considering the consequences.
We can't bring stability and security to the Middle East without a strategy. If the Administration has one, I’m eager to listen, and will work to shape and hone.
The Administration owes the American people a strategy behind these actions. They owe the families of the servicemembers deployed an explanation of why and to what end.
